abstract: Even as the founders continue a plan to sell some of their shares over the next three years through a program they enacted in 2009, they have developed a plan to retain an iron grip over Google.
snippet: Even as the founders continue a plan to sell some of their shares over the next three years through a program they enacted in 2009, they have developed a plan to retain an iron grip over Google.
lead_paragraph: “It’s stupid,” Larry Page, Google’s co-founder and chief executive, exclaimed about the prospect of splitting the company’s shares. “If you own 10 shares at $40 or one share at $400, it’s the same thing! You just need to know how to divide.”

headline.main: Stock Split for Google That Cements Control at the Top

abstract: Hulu plans to pitch original programming, Google’s Sergey Brin describes the threats to an open Internet, and representatives for the hologram of Tupac Shakur are in talks for nationwide tour.
snippet: Hulu plans to pitch original programming, Google’s Sergey Brin describes the threats to an open Internet, and representatives for the hologram of Tupac Shakur are in talks for nationwide tour.
lead_paragraph: Hulu, created as an online service for watching network television, will pitch original programming to advertisers on Thursday as part of the “upfronts,” which are typically reserved for cable channels and network broadcasters. It is quite a shift for Hulu, which is growing steadily (two million subscribers for its $8-a-month Hulu Plus service), Amy Chozick and Brian Stelter write, “despite disagreements among its corporate owners, and the new restrictions those owners have placed on free streaming of network shows.”

headline.main: The Breakfast Meeting: Corporate Control at Google, and a New Tupac Tour?
